message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.CV. 

The paper deals with training deep neural networks for answer selection, which is a task in natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the impact of dataset size on model performance, which is a common concern in machine learning and deep learning, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely sub-category. The paper also mentions the use of algorithms and models, which are common topics in cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper deals with text classification, which is a sub-topic of information retrieval (IR), making cs.IR another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper mentions the use of convolutional neural networks (CNNs), which are commonly used in computer vision (CV), making cs.CV a possible sub-category as well.
